properties.name: HELPSTRING
properties.value: If this value is on, makefiles will be generated without the .SILENT directive, and all commands will be echoed to the console during the make.  This is useful for debugging only. With Visual Studio IDE projects all commands are done without /nologo.

properties.name: HELPSTRING
properties.value: Enable assertions etc. Usually a good idea.

properties.name: HELPSTRING
properties.value: Do all computation in double precision.

properties.name: HELPSTRING
properties.value: Enable FFTW3 for fast image convolution support.

properties.name: HELPSTRING
properties.value: Forces the GUI to use a software fallback mode, which is considerably slower and removes the realtime preview.

properties.name: HELPSTRING
properties.value: Use less memory for storing geometry (at the cost of speed).

properties.name: HELPSTRING
properties.value:
Enable additional checks in the kd-Tree.
This is quite slow and mainly useful to track down bugs when they are suspected.

properties.name: HELPSTRING
properties.value: Enable interprocedural optimizations on Release targets

properties.name: HELPSTRING
properties.value: Use a simple, Windows-like dir structure instead of the typical Unix one.

properties.name: HELPSTRING
properties.value: Do all computation in single precision. This is usually sufficient.

properties.name: HELPSTRING
properties.value:
Number of spectral samples used to render. The default is 3 (RGB-mode).
For high-quality spectral rendering, this should be set to 30 or higher.
